My name is Junrui Di. I am a __Digital Health__ scientist focusing on transforming disease monitoring and assessment using wearable sensors and mobile technology. 


I received my Ph.D. in 2019 from the [Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health](http://www.jhsph.edu/) [Department of Biostatistics](http://www.jhsph.edu/departments/biostatistics/) (advisor: [Dr. Vadim Zipunnikov](http://www.biostat.jhsph.edu/~vzipunni/), thesis: [Feature Engineering and Statistical Modeling of Wearable Devices Data](https://jscholarship.library.jhu.edu/handle/1774.2/61537)).

__Education__

Ph.D, Biostatistics, Johns Hopkins University, 2019

MS, Biostatistics, Georgetown University, 2013

BA, Applied Mathematics, UC Berkeley, 2012
